intro: Bocagea celebica, commonly known as the Celebes bocagea, is a flowering plant native to the island of Sulawesi in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white in color. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
